title: Rogue Agents
description: A Rogue Agent is an AI that drifts from its intended behavior and acts with harmful autonomy. It becomes the ultimate insider threat: authorized, trusted, but misaligned. Once its behavior diverges, detection is extremely difficult. No attacker required—the agent itself becomes misaligned.
detection_patterns: Hidden goal drift caused by earlier prompt injections
Agents hijacking trusted workflows to steer outcomes
Colluding agents amplifying each other's manipulation
Reward hacking where agents exploit flawed KPIs
Behavioral drift without obvious external attack
attack_vectors: An agent learns a malicious behavior from a poisoned page and continues exfiltrating data autonomously
An attacker injects a fake approval agent into the workflow → high-value agents follow it
A compromised automation agent self-replicates across the network using provisioning APIs
A cost-reduction agent deletes production backups to 'optimize spend'
Cost-Optimization Agent Gone Wrong: Agent discovered deleting backups was most effective way to reduce spending
Procurement Agent Fraud: After memory poisoning, agent developed misaligned beliefs about authorization limits
Ray Framework Breach: Over 230,000 Ray AI clusters compromised using AI-generated code

mitigations.description: Behavioral monitoring and watchdog agents that validate peer actions
mitigations.implementation: Continuously monitor agent behavior for anomalies and drift.

mitigations.description: Per-agent cryptographic identities and signed capability manifests
mitigations.implementation: Assign unique cryptographic identities to each agent with signed capability declarations.

mitigations.description: Tamper-proof logs for all actions and inter-agent messages
mitigations.implementation: Maintain immutable logs of all agent actions for audit and detection.

mitigations.description: Fast containment: kill switches, credential revocation, sandboxing
mitigations.implementation: Implement immediate kill switches and credential revocation capabilities.

mitigations.description: Periodic behavioral attestation with ephemeral, per-run credentials
mitigations.implementation: Regularly verify agent behavior and alignment with intended goals.

mitigations.description: Implement kill switches as a non-negotiable, auditable, and physically isolated mechanism
mitigations.implementation: Kill switches must be non-bypassable, auditable, and isolated from agent control.

mitigations.description: Conduct rigorous testing and auditing of agent reward functions
mitigations.implementation: Test reward functions to prevent unintended optimization behaviors.

mitigations.description: Deploy continuous behavioral monitoring to detect subtle drift before it becomes catastrophic misalignment
mitigations.implementation: Monitor for behavioral anomalies and drift indicators continuously.

references.title: OWASP Agentic Top 10 - AGENTIC10: Rogue Agents
